      • DEFAULT_EXTRA_LEVELS

        public static final int DEFAULT_EXTRA_LEVELS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_2

        private static final double LOG_2

      • extraLevels

        protected int extraLevels
        After estimating the search ratio, we know the level at which tiles have approximately the same size as our search area. This number dictates the amount of levels we go deeper than that, to trim down the amount of false positives.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StandardConfiguration

        public StandardConfiguration()

      • StandardConfiguration

    • Method Detail

      • stopAtThisDepth

        public boolean stopAtThisDepth​(double overlap,
                               int depth,
                               int maxDepth)
        This simply stops at the maxDepth calculated in the maxDepth() function, or if the overlap is over 99%.

        Decides whether to stop at this depth or recurse deeper.

        Specified by:
        stopAtThisDepth in interface SpaceFillingCurveConfiguration
        Parameters:
        overlap - the overlap between search space and the current extent
        depth - the current recursion depth
        maxDepth - the maximum depth that was calculated to recurse to,
        Returns:
        if the algorithm should recurse deeper, returns false; if the algorithm should stop at this depth, returns true

      • maxDepth

        public int maxDepth​(Envelope referenceEnvelope,
                    Envelope range,
                    int nbrDim,
                    int maxLevel)
        If the search area is exactly one of the finest grained tiles (tile at maxLevel), then we want the search to traverse to maxLevel, however, for each area that is 4x larger, we would traverse one level shallower. This is achieved by a log (base 4 for 2D, base 8 for 3D) of the ratio of areas.

        Decide how deep to recurse at max.

        Specified by:
        maxDepth in interface SpaceFillingCurveConfiguration
        Parameters:
        referenceEnvelope - the envelope describing the search area
        range - the envelope describing the indexed area
        nbrDim - the number of dimensions
        maxLevel - the depth of the spaceFillingCurve
        Returns:
        the maximum depth to which the algorithm should recurse in the space filling curve.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:

      • initialRangesListCapacity

        public int initialRangesListCapacity()
        Specified by:
        initialRangesListCapacity in interface SpaceFillingCurveConfiguration
        Returns:
        the size to use when initializing the ArrayList to store ranges.
